net.sourceforge.JDash.gui
Class DashboardFrame

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      net.sourceforge.JDash.gui.DashboardFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class DashboardFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame

This class will display the main dashboard frame to the user. It will get the skin from the Setup class, and use the skin to populate the look and feel of this dashboard.

See Also:

Method Detail

suspendGaugeDisplayUpdates

public void suspendGaugeDisplayUpdates(boolean suspend)
call this method to suspend gauge updates. This is used primarily by the logg playback capability. In order to increase performance, this method is called to prevent screen re-draws. Once done, this method will re-enable the updates.

Parameters:
suspend -

showMessage

public void showMessage(DashboardFrame.MESSAGE_TYPE type,
                        java.lang.String title,
                        java.lang.String message)
Display to the user a basic message. This is a convience method for child classes.

Parameters:
type - IN - the type of message.
title - IN - the Title of the message box
message - IN - the message itself
